item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "If we had a keen vision and feeling of all ordinary human life, it would be like hearing the grass grow and the squirrel's heart beat, and we should die of that roar which lies on the other side of silence." -- George Eliot

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by Robert Bringhurst
item.description: "A man who would letterspace lower case would steal sheep, Frederic Goudy liked to say. If this wisdom needs updating, it is chiefly to add that a woman who would letterspace lower case would steal sheep as well ." -- Robert Bringhurst

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by Jean Rostand
item.description: "The obligation to endure gives us the right to know." -- Jean Rostand

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by Marvin Minsky
item.description: "General fiction is pretty much about ways that people get into problems and screw their lives up. Science fiction is about everything else." -- Marvin Minsky

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "He can kill anything for need but he could not even hurt a feeling for pleasure." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "God himself culminates in the present moment, and will never be more divine in the lapse of all the ages." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by Black Thought
item.description: "Fuck getting money for real, get freedom." -- Black Thought

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by Terry Gilliam
item.description: "We suffered for our art. You have to suffer for our art as well!" -- Terry Gilliam

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Good art is not universal. Bruce Willis is universal." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Ken-ichi add a quote by James Tiptree Jr.
item.description: "Man is an animal whose dreams come true and kill him." -- James Tiptree Jr.
